articles.content:
S. Korean "Ministry of National Defence's" decision for arms buildup flayed
    Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- The Seoul district federation of university student councils was reported to have issued a statement on January 26 denouncing the South Korean "Ministry of National Defence" for its decision to introduce 36 assault helicopters "AH-X" (two squadrons) and their necessary equipment from the united states by spending 2,100 billion won per year till 2006. 
 The statement branded this plan as an anti-reunification and treacherous move to keep the country divided through their manoeuvres to start a war and escalate tensions and as a violation of the June 15 joint declaration.    
 It urged the "ministry" to cancel its plan and come to its senses in order to honestly implement the joint declaration and the joint press statement of the inter-Korean military talks.

articles.content:
Cooperation between DPRK and UNICEF
    Pyongyang, February 3 (KCNA) -- The 2001-2003 master plan of operation was signed here today between the DPRK and the UNICEF.
 According to the plan, the UNICEF will assist the DPRK in three years to come in education, children's nutrition and health and water sanitation.    
 The plan was signed by Choe Su Hon, vice-minister of foreign affairs and concurrently chairman of the UNICEF national coordinating committee of the DPRK, and Dilawar Ali Khan, representative of the UNICEF here.
